definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)

sentences.english: It is hard to free fools from the chains they revere.
sentences.chinese: 將愚人從他們所敬拜的鎖鏈下解放出來是非常困難的。

sentences.english: Today is April 1. it April fool's day.
sentences.chinese: 今天是四月一號是愚人節。

sentences.english: You may laugh at a prank on April Fools' Day.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會因爲愚人節的一個惡作劇而發笑。

sentences.english: Though thou shouldst bray a fool in the mortar, as when a pestle striketh upon sodden barley, his folly would not be taken from him.
sentences.chinese: 你儘可在臼中將愚人舂碎，但他的昏愚卻永不能剷除。

sentences.english: A:Do you know about All Fools' Day?
sentences.chinese: 你知道愚人節是怎麼回事檯球？

sentences.english: Every April Fool 's Day, Xiaoqiang would think of ways to trick others.
sentences.chinese: 小強每年愚人節都想着法子捉弄別人。

sentences.english: There awas once a foolish man. One day he wanted to go to the market to buy a pair of new shoes.
sentences.chinese: 從前有個愚人，有一天想上市去買雙新鞋。

sentences.english: Speak not in the ears of fools: because they will despise the instruction of thy speech.
sentences.chinese: 不要與愚人交耳接談，因他必輕視你的高見。

sentences.english: It is a tale told by an idiot.
sentences.chinese: 它是一個愚人所講的罥故事。

sentences.english: Will be that April Fool's Day , I want several well tomorrow , will persecute others conveniently method.
sentences.chinese: 明天就是愚人節，我要幾個好的，方便的整人方法。

sentences.english: Google has a tradition of perpetrating April Fools' Day hoaxes.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌有個在愚人節捉弄人的傳統。

sentences.english: I was hoaxed on the April Fools' Day.
sentences.chinese: 愚人節我被人涮了一把。

sentences.english: The fool fills himself up with evil, even if collecting it just little by little.
sentences.chinese: 如同滴水能注滿水瓶，愚人累積小惡至罪惡滿盈。

sentences.english: I would not call thee fool, old man.
sentences.chinese: 我不會喚汝愚人，年長知者。

sentences.english: We will not be swept aside by this petulant fool!
sentences.chinese: 我們，是不會被這個討厭的愚人所替代的。

sentences.english: Judgments are prepared for scorners: and striking hammers for the bodies of fools.
sentences.chinese: 體刑是爲輕狂人而設，鞭笞是爲愚人背而備。

definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)
ignorant masses/to keep the people in ignorance
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
